title: As a User, I want to edit a player's position on the Interest List

* It will be a dropdown populated with the same positions available on the player profile (provided data discovery)

* Users may override position that comes from ebis
* Modifying the position will not send updates to ebis
* Changing Position will activate Save button
* Clicking Save will commit changes

* The number of players on the Provisional will show in the header

title: As User, I want to see Eligible Players on the Available Player List
custom_steps:
*Wireframe(s):*

Available Players: [https://zpl.io/aMpJND7|https://zpl.io/aMpJND7]

h6. _Note: This story covers the section on the Qualifying Rosters tab and not the Rosters tab, as depicted in the wireframe.  Both tabs will have the same sections._



* The first section on the Qualifying Roster tab will be title Available and be collapsed by default
* The number of players on the available players list will show in the header
* There will be text indicating how many players can be added to the provision roster where the number of players is based on the provisional max limit for the qualifying tournament
* The section will contain all the selected Federations player's with an Eligibility Status of Approved
* BOC users will see a federation dropdown to switch between rosters
* Clicking on the players name should open the profile

title: As a BOC Admin, I would like to see a list of all WBC Users
custom_steps:
*Wireframe(s):*

Users: [https://zpl.io/2jW4BYA|https://zpl.io/2jW4BYA]

Log in as BOC Admin
Click to user administration page
See list of users by their federation 
See the role that the users are assigned within WBC
User roles are stored in WBC Database
User list is also stored in LDAP for authentication purposes

User management / Permissions management are handled in separate stories

title: As a BOC Admin, I want the ability to register a user in LDAP
custom_steps:
*NOTE: This story is a work in progress, and may be updated/closed*

In order for a user to get authenticated, they need to be registered in LDAP. They can self-reg, but if processes change, a BOC Admin may be able to initiate that registration process for a particular user.

*AC:*

* The admin or user will enter the userâ€™s email in self reg
* If the LDAP account does not yet exist, they input the userâ€™s name, email, selected role, and other metadata.
* LDAP WBC Admin can then go to user administration and retrieve list of pending users
* WBC Admin can approve the user and assign the role of BOC Administrator, WBC Federation Admin, or WBC Federation user. The user is then added to the wbc-users group in LDAP and the appropriate role group - wbc-boc-admin, wbc-fed-team-admin, wbc-fed-team-user
* The user would appear in the list of users within WBC. A WBC admin can then assign a federation for the user

title: As a BOC Admin, I want the ability to update/remove a user from a particular federation team
custom_steps:
BOC Admins should have the ability to change an assigned user's mapping to a federation team, or remove a user's mapping entirely.



*Wireframes(s):*

Users: [https://zpl.io/2jW4BYA|https://zpl.io/2jW4BYA]

*AC*:

* Using a separate page/tab, see a table of users and the team(s) they are assigned for.
* Maybe even see what _role_ said user has in LDAP (so 2-3 columns)
* In the column with the fed team, it can default to empty. An admin can select the fed team(s) from the dropdown

title: As a BOC Admin, I want the ability to assign a user to a specific federation team
custom_steps:
BOC Admins need the ability to assign a registered user to a particular federation.

*AC*:
* Using a separate page/tab, see a table of users and the team(s) they are assigned for.
* Maybe even see what _role_ said user has in LDAP (so 2-3 columns)
* In the column with the fed team, it can default to empty. An admin can select the fed team from the dropdown.
* By hitting â€œConfirmâ€￾, the user is assigned to a particular Fed team

title: As a BOC admin I want to see all Federation Team dropdowns in alphabetical order
custom_steps:
AC:
* The federation dropdown on the Prospective Players and Interest List tabs should display in alphabetical order.

Note: This dropdown will also appear on other tabs that have not been built yet.  Can this work be done with this story or will we need to include AC on the stories for creating those pages?

title: As a WBC user I want to know whether I've entered a valid email address or not
custom_steps:
Design: https://zpl.io/VQQAAyn

AC:
* If a valid email address has been entered a green checkmark will display next to the email field and the red outline will go away
* If an invalid email address has been entered a red x will display next to the email field and the message "invalid format" will display above the field

title: As a WBC user I want a close button on the profile if no changes have been made
custom_steps:
AC:
* If no changes have been made to the profile show an enabled close button instead of a disabled cancel button
* If changes have been made show a enabled cancel button and hide the close button
* Clicking close takes the user back to their point of entry.  (If the user clicked on the player name from the interest list they should go back to that tab and not just back to the first tab)

title: Denies Player Eligibility
custom_steps:
*Wireframe(s):*
BOC Player Eligibility: [https://zpl.io/V19YDYw|https://zpl.io/V19YDYw]

BOC Denies Eligibility: [https://zpl.io/25A3x58|https://zpl.io/25A3x58]

AC:

* There will be a Deny button on every player with a Pending Status' row, as depicted in the wire
* Clicking Deny will display a modal, as depicted in the wire
* The modal will have a required Reason for â€œEligibility Denialâ€￾
* There will be an inactive Deny button on the modal
* There will be a Cancel button on the modal
** Clicking Cancel will dismiss the modal
* When comments have been entered in the comment box, the Deny button will become active
* Clicking Deny will update the playerâ€™s eligibility status to Denied
* The modal will close and there will be a green Denied confirmation message
* The player will remain on the Federationâ€™s Interest List with a Denied status and a comments bubble with the Reason for Eligibility Denial

custom_steps:
*Wireframe(s):*
BOC Player Eligibility: [https://zpl.io/V19YDYw|https://zpl.io/V19YDYw]

AC:

* There will be an Approve button on every player with a Pending Status' row, as depicted in the wire
* Clicking the Approve button will update the playerâ€™s Eligibility Status to Approved
* A green Approved confirmation will be displayed
* Player will continue to appear on the Federationâ€™s Interest List
* Approving a player will add the player to the Federation's Available Players List (future story)

title: As a BOC User, I want to View the Player Eligibility Screen
custom_steps:
*Wireframe(s):*
BOC Player Eligibility: [https://zpl.io/V19YDYw|https://zpl.io/V19YDYw]

Data Discovery: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/6226038/Player+Eligibility|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/6226038/Player+Eligibility|smart-link] 

AC:

* BOC Users will see a Player Eligibility tab in the Top Nav of the WBC Portal as depicted in the wire
* Clicking on Player Eligibility will load the Player Eligibility Dashboard

title: Submit Player for Eligibility from Interest List
custom_steps:
*Wireframe(s):*
Submit for Eligibility: [https://zpl.io/bz7DLdz|https://zpl.io/bz7DLdz]

AC:

* Clicking on the Options Icon on a player's row, will launch the options menu, as depicted in the wire
* On the options menu, "submit for eligibility" will be an option
* Clicking submit for eligibility will submit the player to the BOC for review
* The playerâ€™s Eligibility status will be updated to Pending
* A green confirmation message will be displayed â€œSubmittedâ€￾
* One document must be attached for the player to be submitted for eligibility.  
* If no documents have been uploaded the link is greyed out in the options
* BOC should always be able to submit and never have a greyed out link

title: Add Player Documents via Player Profile
custom_steps:
*Wireframe(s):* 

Player Profile: [https://zpl.io/brMyMMe|https://zpl.io/brMyMMe]

AC:

* At the bottom of the player profile, there will be a Player Document section as depicted in the provided wire.
* You will be able to drag and drop file attachments
* You will be able to click Browse and open a file browser to attach files
* You will be able to attach multiple files
* There will be a trash can icon for each file attached
** Clicking the trash can will remove the file
* There will be a required label field for attached files
* Label option will be:
** Birth Certificate
** Passport
** Other
* Labelâ€™s may be used more than once
* The section will follow clean/dirty form guidelines
** Save / Cancel button will become active when any changes are made
* Clicking the file name of the uploaded document will download the file

title: Add Player Documents via Interest List
custom_steps:
As a Federation User or Team Coordinator, I want to upload player documents from the Interest List so I can submit the player for Eligibility

*Wireframe(s):* 

Interest List: [https://zpl.io/a3j5Oyy|https://zpl.io/a3j5Oyy]

Upload Docs Via Interest List: [https://zpl.io/bJWdJdD|https://zpl.io/bJWdJdD]

AC:

* Clicking on the Options Icon on a player's row, will launch the options menu, as depicted in the wire
* On the options menu, "Player Docs" will be an option
* Clicking a Player Docs will launch the upload modal
* You will be able to drag and drop file attachments to the modal
* You will be able to click Browse and open a file browser to attach files
* You will be able to attach multiple files
* There will be a trash can icon for each file attached
** Clicking the trash can will remove the file
* There will be a required label field for attached files
* Label option will be:
** Birth Certificate
** Passport
** Other
* Labelâ€™s may be used more than once
* When a label has been added for all attached files, the Save Documents button will become active
* Clicking save documents will attach the files and commit changes, dismiss the modal, and return a green confirmation message
* Clicking Cancel will prompt the user to confirm they wish to discard their changes
** If they confirm the decision, their changes will be discarded and the form will reload in view mode
** If they do not confirm the decision, the user will be returned to the form and no action will be taken.

title: As a WBC user I want to see a mobile nav on screen sizes 1023 and under
custom_steps:
Design: https://zpl.io/2GWeyJ3

AC:
* Switch to mobile nav at 1023 instead of 767. (there will not be enough room for all the tabs under 1024)
* Update mobile nav to include the different tournaments in the system, the current or upcoming tournament year should be expanded by default, any others should be collapsed. 
*Add the username and Sign Out link to the mobile nav.  The username section should be expanded by default.

title: Styling for search input
custom_steps:
AC:
The search input on the prospective players tab should be styled like other inputs in the system.

* Border radius, border color, padding and height should be the same as the country select next to it.
* update the font-size of placeholders globally to something smaller.

title: UX Improvement for Add Federation Teams Modal
custom_steps:
h2. AC
* Hitting enter when teams have been selected in the multi-select and the dropdown list is not visible should act the same way as using the mouse to click save. 
* While typing to search for countries the user should be able to use the arrow keys to scroll the dropdown list

title: Styling for the user dropdown
custom_steps:
h2. Design: https://zpl.io/2EWN6vY

AC:
* Clicking on the username or arrow will open a popover with a Sign Out link
* The popover should appear directly beneath the arrow.  It's currently left aligned with the username.

title: Rosters | Create Interest List Tab and Page
custom_steps:
As a BOC admin, I want to view all Federation Teams' interest lists

As a federation admin, I want to view my team's interest list.

h2. AC
# Create a tab in the top nav called "Interest List"
## This tab should be visible to BOC Admins and Federation Users of any type
# At the top of the page, display a heading that says "Interest List" with the country flag to the left of the words.
# For BOC users, display a dropdown that enables the user to select a federation team. Only teams in the current tournament should be visible in the list.
# Display the maximum number of allowed interest list players from the roster settings
# Display a list of players who have been added to the interest list by the federation.
## A stoplight icon (no functionality as part of this story)
## Last name
## First name
## Position
## Org
## Club
## A docs icon (no functionality as part of this story)
## Eligibility status (no functionality as part of this story)
## IL Flag
## 40 man flag

h2. Design
https://zpl.io/a3j5Oyy

title: Hide old environment indicator
custom_steps:
AC:
* The only indictor is the one inside the WBC pinwheel logo

title: Unsaved changes page behavior and modal
custom_steps:
As a user, I want to be reminded when I have unsaved changes on a page and attempt to leave the page so that I don't lose my changes.

h2. AC

# When a user is on a page with unsaved changes and they attempt to leave the page, display a modal
## *When a user is on a page with unsaved changes and no missing required fields display this modal* [https://zpl.io/bz6K7Oz|https://zpl.io/bz6K7Oz]
### Clicking "save changes" will save the changes from the page, close the modal, throw a green success notification "Saved" and navigate the user to where they were trying to go.
### Clicking "discard changes" will discard the changes and take the user to where they originally tried to navigate.
### Clicking the X dismisses the modal
## *When a user is on a page with unsaved changes but there are still missing required fields display this modal* [https://zpl.io/VQ1YAR5|https://zpl.io/VQ1YAR5]
### Clicking "discard changes" will discard the changes and take the user to where they originally tried to navigate.
### Clicking â€œbackâ€￾ dismisses the modal
### Clicking the X dismisses the modal

title: Player Profile Form - Info Tab
custom_steps:
As a BOC admin or Federation Admin, I want the ability to view and edit a player profile so that their information is always up to date.

As a Federation User, I want the ability to view a profile so that I can see the information about a specific player.

h2. AC
# On the info tab, create the player info form
# The BOC admin will see a dropdown which will enable them to switch back and forth between views if the player is on the prospective player list of multiple teams
# The profile will have four sections and respective fields
## Bio Information
### First Name
### Last Name
### Birth Date
### Birth Country
### Birth State
### Birth CIty
## Contact Information
### Phone Type (Mobile, Home, Other)
### Country Code (dropdown of countries)
### Phone Number
### Email Type (Personal, Other)
### Email Address
## Baseball Information
### Org
### Club
### Position
### Height
### Weight
### Bats
### Throws
## Address
### Address type (Home, Other)
### Country
### Street Address 1
### Street Address 2
### Street Address 3
### City
### State
### ZIP Code
# When the form is clean, the save and cancel buttons are greyed out.
# When the form is dirty, the save and cancel buttons are active. 
## Clicking save saves the form
## Clicking cancel closes the form
# When the form is dirty, display an asterisk icon next to the info tab.
# All fields are required except org and club name.
# After a profile is created, First name, last name, birth country and DOB will be locked from editing.

h2. Data Discovery
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/BES/Data+Discovery

h2. Designs
Ebis Player: https://zpl.io/brMyMMe
Non-ebis player: https://zpl.io/aNDkDWD
Unsaved Changes UX: https://zpl.io/brMkBAO
Saving Changes UX: https://zpl.io/V45xLD4

title: Federation Teams Remove Team Actions
custom_steps:
As a BOC Admin, I want to delete a federation team if they should not be in the tournament.

h2. AC
# If a user clicks the trash can icon next to a team in the tournament remove that team from the UI and enable the save/cancel buttons in the header
